intro: Correa reflexa var. pulchella, commonly known as the pink correa, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its soft, velvety foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in coastal heathlands and prefers well-drained soils and full sun exposure. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in mild coastal climates.
